msContents.summary: Miscellaneous collection of historical works with an emphasis in refined prose. Volume not dated; datable to the early nineteenth century. Relatively modern scribal nastaʿlīq. Partial foliation in pencil. Lacking original binding. Paper dust wrapper (BEIC legal publication on legislation; dated 1851); watermarked (C Wilmot, 1849); labelled, torn, creased, and stained. Folios unbound; light fungal stains, cropped, aggressive wormhole damage along the lower half, carving depressions into the text block as deep as folio 93 from the front side. Condition extremely fragile.

note.p: Fragment of a treatise on Persian grammar by Munshīʾ Siddhī Laʿl.
This ostensibly complete copy has been most aggressively attacked by insects along the lower half, rendering the text unusable, except for the remaining upper portions.
Untitled account in highly refined prose on the siege of a rebel fort in the Panjāb by an unnamed author, similar in content to items c, d, e, f, and g.
Untitled account in highly refined prose on the siege of the rebel fort of Kāngrah in the Panjāb by an unnamed author, similar in content to items b, d, e, f, and g.
Untitled account in highly refined prose on the siege of the rebel fort in the Panjāb by an unnamed author, similar in content to items b, c, e, f, and g.
Untitled account in highly refined prose on the siege of the rebel fort of Kāngrah in the Panjāb by an unnamed author, similar in content to items b, c, d, f, and g.
Untitled account in highly refined prose on the siege of the rebel fort of Kāngrah in the Panjāb by an unnamed author, similar in content to items b, c, d, e, and g.
Untitled account in highly refined prose on the siege of the rebel fort of Kāngrah in the Panjāb by an unnamed author, similar in content to items b, c, d, e and f.
Partially dated colophon (f. 134v): completed by Bisan Singh, Tuesday, in the month of Bhādon.

Untitled qaṣīdah or eulogy in honour of the Governor-General, composed by Munshīʾ Mangal Singh of the Sūrdhaj Brahmin caste (qawm) presented in Kalkattah (Calcutta/Kolkata) at a mushāʿirah (gathering for poetic recitations) held at the house of Munshīʾ Amīn al-Dīn Aḥmad, through the introduction of Munshīʾ Muḥammad Aḥsan.
The work begins with a brief statement précising a lengthier statement at the end describing the circumstances of composition and presentation to the subject.
Untitled second qaṣīdah or eulogy in honour of the Governor-General, composed by (the deceased) Munshīʾ Mangal Singh of the Sūrdhaj Brahmin caste (qawm) presented in Kalkattah (Calcutta/Kolkata).
The work begins with a brief statement recording its authorship and place of presentation, but without the detail given at the end of item h.

provenance.p: Purchased by the Government of India at sale organised by Delhi Prize Agents, 1859; administrative deposit India Office Library, 1876

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact British Library, Registering for a Reader Pass. Contact apac-enquiries@bl.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript. For information on catalogues and ordering manuscripts see Finding and ordering Persian manuscripts in the British Library.

revisionDesc.change: Julian Cook 850 BL Persian mss prepared for initial publication in FIHRIST (plus 18 replacements)
